   250	            if failed_bootstrap_addr in self.addr_to_rooms_tracker:
   251	                del self.addr_to_rooms_tracker[failed_bootstrap_addr]
   252	
   253	        # Report the requests associated with the failed bootstrap addr and mark their status as KVPoll.Failed
   254	        affected_rooms = []
   255	        for room in possible_affected_rooms:

   257	                room in self.request_status

   260	                self.record_failure(

   262	                    f"Losing connection with prefill instance (bootstrap_addr: {failed_bootstrap_addr})",
   263	                )
   264	                self.update_status(room, KVPoll.Failed)
   265	                affected_rooms.append(room)

   267	            f"Losing connection with prefill instance (bootstrap_addr: {failed_bootstrap_addr}), affected {len(affected_rooms)} requests"
   268	        )

   147	    @classmethod
   148	    def _connect(cls, endpoint: str):
   149	        with cls._global_lock:
   150	            if endpoint not in cls._socket_cache:
   151	                sock = cls._ctx.socket(zmq.PUSH)
   152	                sock.connect(endpoint)
   153	                cls._socket_cache[endpoint] = sock
   154	                cls._socket_locks[endpoint] = threading.Lock()
   155	            return cls._socket_cache[endpoint], cls._socket_locks[endpoint]

   161	            )
   162	            is_dummy = bootstrap_info["is_dummy"]
   163	
   164	            sock, lock = self._connect("tcp://" + self.prefill_server_url)
   165	            with lock:

   167	                    [

   171	                        self.session_id.encode("ascii"),

   178	    def poll(self) -> KVPoll:
   179	        if self.conclude_state is None:
   180	            status = self.kv_mgr.check_status(self.bootstrap_room)
   181	            if status in (KVPoll.Success, KVPoll.Failed):
   182	                self.conclude_state = status
   183	
   184	            return status
   185	        else:
   186	            return self.conclude_state

   188	    def clear(self) -> None:
   189	        if self.bootstrap_room in self.kv_mgr.request_status:
   190	            self.kv_mgr.request_status.pop(self.bootstrap_room)

   192	    def failure_exception(self):
   193	        self.clear()
   194	
   195	        # Explicitly set the status to failure since this request has failed in another rank
   196	        if self.conclude_state is None:
   197	            self.conclude_state = KVPoll.Failed
   198	
   199	        with self.kv_mgr.failure_lock:
   200	            failure_reason = self.kv_mgr.failure_records.pop(
   201	                self.bootstrap_room, "Failed due to an unknown reason from another rank"
   202	            )
   203	        raise KVTransferError(self.bootstrap_room, failure_reason)

   206	class MooncakeKVBootstrapServer(BaseKVBootstrapServer):
   207	    def __init__(self, port: int):
   208	        self.port = port
   209	        self.app = web.Application()
   210	        self.store = dict()
   211	        self.lock = asyncio.Lock()
   212	        self._setup_routes()
   213	        self.tp_size = None
   214	        self.dp_size = None
   215	        self.tp_size_per_dp_rank = None
   216	        self.prefill_port_table: Dict[int, Dict[int, Dict[str, Union[str, int]]]] = {}
   217	
   218	        # Start bootstrap server
   219	        self.thread = threading.Thread(target=self._run_server, daemon=True)
   220	        self.run()
   221	
   222	    def run(self):
   223	        self.thread.start()
   224	
   225	    def _setup_routes(self):
   226	        self.app.router.add_route("*", "/route", self._handle_route)
   227	        self.app.router.add_get("/health", self._handle_health_check)
   228	
   229	    async def _handle_health_check(self, request):
   230	        return web.Response(text="OK", status=200)
   231	
   232	    async def _handle_route(self, request: web.Request):
   233	        method = request.method
   234	        if method == "PUT":
   235	            return await self._handle_route_put(request)
   236	        elif method == "GET":
   237	            return await self._handle_route_get(request)
   238	        else:
   239	            return web.Response(
   240	                text="Method not allowed", status=405, content_type="application/json"
   241	            )
   242	
   243	    async def _handle_route_put(self, request: web.Request):
   244	        data = await request.json()
   245	        role = data["role"]
   246	        tp_size = data["tp_size"]
   247	        dp_size = data["dp_size"]
   248	        rank_ip = data["rank_ip"]
   249	        rank_port = int(data["rank_port"])
   250	        engine_rank = int(data["engine_rank"])
   251	
   252	        if self.tp_size is None:
   253	            self.tp_size = tp_size
   254	
   255	        if self.dp_size is None:
   256	            self.dp_size = dp_size
   257	
   258	        tp_size_per_dp_rank = tp_size // dp_size
   259	        if self.tp_size_per_dp_rank is None:
   260	            self.tp_size_per_dp_rank = tp_size_per_dp_rank
   261	
   262	        if role == "Prefill":
   263	            dp_group = engine_rank // tp_size_per_dp_rank
   264	            tp_rank_in_dp_group = engine_rank % tp_size_per_dp_rank
   265	
   266	            # Add lock to make sure thread-safe
   267	            async with self.lock:
   268	                if dp_group not in self.prefill_port_table:
   269	                    self.prefill_port_table[dp_group] = {}
   270	
   271	            self.prefill_port_table[dp_group][tp_rank_in_dp_group] = {
   272	                "rank_ip": rank_ip,
   273	                "rank_port": rank_port,
   274	            }
   275	            logger.debug(
   276	                f"Register prefill bootstrap: {engine_rank} with rank_ip: {rank_ip} and rank_port: {rank_port}"
   277	            )
   278	
   279	        return web.Response(text="OK", status=200)
   280	
   281	    async def _handle_route_get(self, request: web.Request):
   282	        engine_rank = request.query.get("engine_rank")
   283	        target_dp_group = request.query.get("target_dp_group")
   284	        if not engine_rank or not target_dp_group:
   285	            return web.Response(text="Missing inputs for bootstrap server.", status=400)
   286	
   287	        # Currently we use engine_rank == -1 and target_dp_group == -1 to sync dp size
   288	        if int(engine_rank) == -1 and int(target_dp_group) == -1:
   289	            prefill_parallel_info = {
   290	                "prefill_tp_size": self.tp_size,
   291	                "prefill_dp_size": self.dp_size,
   292	            }
   293	            return web.json_response(prefill_parallel_info, status=200)
   294	
   295	        # Find corresponding prefill info
   296	        async with self.lock:
   297	            bootstrap_info = self.prefill_port_table[int(target_dp_group)][
   298	                int(engine_rank)
   299	            ]
   300	
   301	        if bootstrap_info is not None:
   302	            return web.json_response(bootstrap_info, status=200)
   303	        else:
   304	            return web.Response(text="Bootstrap info not Found", status=404)
   305	
   306	    def _run_server(self):
   307	        try:
   308	            # Event Loop
   309	            self._loop = asyncio.new_event_loop()
   310	            asyncio.set_event_loop(self._loop)
   311	
   312	            access_log = None
   313	            if logging.getLogger(__name__).getEffectiveLevel() <= logging.DEBUG:
   314	                access_log = self.app.logger
   315	
   316	            self._runner = web.AppRunner(self.app, access_log=access_log)
   317	            self._loop.run_until_complete(self._runner.setup())
   318	
   319	            site = web.TCPSite(self._runner, port=self.port)
   320	            self._loop.run_until_complete(site.start())
   321	            self._loop.run_forever()
   322	        except Exception as e:
   323	            logger.error(f"Server error: {str(e)}")
   324	        finally:
   325	            # Cleanup
   326	            self._loop.run_until_complete(self._runner.cleanup())
   327	            self._loop.close()
   328	
   329	    def close(self):
   330	        """Shutdown"""
   331	        if self._loop is not None and self._loop.is_running():
   332	            self._loop.call_soon_threadsafe(self._loop.stop)
   333	            logger.info("Stopping server loop...")
   334	
   335	        if self.thread.is_alive():
   336	            self.thread.join(timeout=2)
   337	            logger.info("Server thread stopped")
   338

   147	    @classmethod
   148	    def _connect(cls, endpoint: str):

   152	                sock.connect(endpoint)
   153	                cls._socket_cache[endpoint] = sock
   154	                cls._socket_locks[endpoint] = threading.Lock()

   158	        for bootstrap_info in self.bootstrap_infos:

   164	            sock, lock = self._connect("tcp://" + self.prefill_server_url)

   178	    def poll(self) -> KVPoll:
   179	        if self.conclude_state is None:
   180	            status = self.kv_mgr.check_status(self.bootstrap_room)
   181	            if status in (KVPoll.Success, KVPoll.Failed):
   182	                self.conclude_state = status
   183	
   184	            return status
   185	        else:
   186	            return self.conclude_state

   188	    def clear(self) -> None:
   189	        if self.bootstrap_room in self.kv_mgr.request_status:

   192	    def failure_exception(self):
   193	        self.clear()

   196	        if self.conclude_state is None:
   197	            self.conclude_state = KVPoll.Failed
   198	
   199	        with self.kv_mgr.failure_lock:
   200	            failure_reason = self.kv_mgr.failure_records.pop(

   203	        raise KVTransferError(self.bootstrap_room, failure_reason)

   206	class MooncakeKVBootstrapServer(BaseKVBootstrapServer):
   207	    def __init__(self, port: int):

   223	        self.thread.start()

   225	    def _setup_routes(self):
   226	        self.app.router.add_route("*", "/route", self._handle_route)
   227	        self.app.router.add_get("/health", self._handle_health_check)
   228	
   229	    async def _handle_health_check(self, request):
   230	        return web.Response(text="OK", status=200)
   231	
   232	    async def _handle_route(self, request: web.Request):
   233	        method = request.method
   234	        if method == "PUT":
   235	            return await self._handle_route_put(request)
   236	        elif method == "GET":
   237	            return await self._handle_route_get(request)
   238	        else:
   239	            return web.Response(

   241	            )
   242	
   243	    async def _handle_route_put(self, request: web.Request):

   251	
   252	        if self.tp_size is None:
   253	            self.tp_size = tp_size
   254	
   255	        if self.dp_size is None:
   256	            self.dp_size = dp_size
   257	
   258	        tp_size_per_dp_rank = tp_size // dp_size
   259	        if self.tp_size_per_dp_rank is None:
   260	            self.tp_size_per_dp_rank = tp_size_per_dp_rank
   261	
   262	        if role == "Prefill":
   263	            dp_group = engine_rank // tp_size_per_dp_rank
   264	            tp_rank_in_dp_group = engine_rank % tp_size_per_dp_rank
   265	
   266	            # Add lock to make sure thread-safe
   267	            async with self.lock:
   268	                if dp_group not in self.prefill_port_table:
   269	                    self.prefill_port_table[dp_group] = {}
   270	
   271	            self.prefill_port_table[dp_group][tp_rank_in_dp_group] = {
   272	                "rank_ip": rank_ip,
   273	                "rank_port": rank_port,
   274	            }
   275	            logger.debug(
   276	                f"Register prefill bootstrap: {engine_rank} with rank_ip: {rank_ip} and rank_port: {rank_port}"
   277	            )
   278	
   279	        return web.Response(text="OK", status=200)
   280	
   281	    async def _handle_route_get(self, request: web.Request):
   282	        engine_rank = request.query.get("engine_rank")
   283	        target_dp_group = request.query.get("target_dp_group")
   284	        if not engine_rank or not target_dp_group:
   285	            return web.Response(text="Missing inputs for bootstrap server.", status=400)
   286

     1	# PD Disaggregation
     2	
     3	## Why and What is PD Disaggregation?
     4	
     5	Large Language Model (LLM) inference comprises two distinct phases: **Prefill** and **Decode**. The Prefill phase is computation-intensive, processing the entire input sequence, while the Decode phase is memory-intensive, managing the Key-Value (KV) cache for token generation. Traditionally, these phases are handled within a unified engine, where combined scheduling of prefill and decode batches introduces inefficiencies. To address these challenges, we introduce **Prefill and Decoding (PD) Disaggregation** in SGLang.
     6	
     7	### Issues with Unified Scheduling
     8	
     9	The conventional unified engine, which processes prefill and decode batches together, results in two significant problems:
    10	
    11	1. **Prefill Interruption**: Incoming prefill batches frequently interrupt ongoing decode batches, causing substantial delays in token generation.
    12	2. **DP Attention Imbalance**: In data-parallel (DP) attention, one DP worker may process a prefill batch while another handles a decode batch simultaneously, leading to increased decode latency.
    13	
    14	PD Disaggregation resolves these by separating the two stages, enabling tailored optimizations for each.
    15	
    16	For the design details, please refer to [link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rQXJwKd5b9b1aOzLh98mnyMhBMhlxXA5ATZTHoQrwvc/edit?tab=t.0).
    17	
    18	Currently, we support Mooncake and NIXL as the transfer engine.
    19	
    20	
    21	## Mooncake
    22	### Requirements
    23	
    24	```bash
    25	uv pip install mooncake-transfer-engine
    26	```
    27	
    28	### Usage
    29	
    30	### Llama Single Node
    31	
    32	```bash
    33	$ python -m sglang.launch_server --model-path meta-llama/Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct --disaggregation-mode prefill --disaggregation-ib-device mlx5_roce0
    34	$ python -m sglang.launch_server --model-path meta-llama/Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct --disaggregation-mode decode --port 30001 --base-gpu-id 1 --disaggregation-ib-device mlx5_roce0
    35	$ python -m sglang.srt.disaggregation.mini_lb --prefill http://127.0.0.1:30000 --decode http://127.0.0.1:30001 --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000
    36	```
    37	
    38	### DeepSeek Multi-Node
    39	
    40	```bash
    41	# prefill 0
    42	$ python -m sglang.launch_server --model-path deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-V3-0324 --disaggregation-ib-device ${device_name} --disaggregation-mode prefill --host ${local_ip} --port 30000 --trust-remote-code --dist-init-addr ${prefill_master_ip}:5000 --nnodes 2 --node-rank 0 --tp-size 16 --dp-size 8 --enable-dp-attention --enable-deepep-moe --deepep-mode normal --mem-fraction-static 0.8
    43	# prefill 1
    44	$ python -m sglang.launch_server --model-path deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-V3-0324 --disaggregation-ib-device ${device_name} --disaggregation-mode prefill --host ${local_ip} --port 30000 --trust-remote-code --dist-init-addr ${prefill_master_ip}:5000 --nnodes 2 --node-rank 1 --tp-size 16 --dp-size 8 --enable-dp-attention --enable-deepep-moe --deepep-mode normal --mem-fraction-static 0.8
    45	# decode 0
    46	$ python -m sglang.launch_server --model-path deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-V3-0324 --disaggregation-ib-device ${device_name} --disaggregation-mode decode --host ${local_ip} --port 30001 --trust-remote-code --dist-init-addr ${decode_master_ip}:5000 --nnodes 2 --node-rank 0 --tp-size 16 --dp-size 8 --enable-dp-attention --enable-deepep-moe --deepep-mode low_latency --mem-fraction-static 0.8 --max-running-requests 128
    47	# decode 1
    48	$ python -m sglang.launch_server --model-path deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-V3-0324 --disaggregation-ib-device ${device_name} --disaggregation-mode decode --host ${local_ip} --port 30001 --trust-remote-code --dist-init-addr ${decode_master_ip}:5000 --nnodes 2 --node-rank 1 --tp-size 16 --dp-size 8 --enable-dp-attention --enable-deepep-moe --deepep-mode low_latency --mem-fraction-static 0.8 --max-running-requests 128
    49	```
    50	
    51	## NIXL

    56	```bash
    57	pip install nixl
    58	```

import time
import random

# Benchmark 1: cleanup strategy from heartbeat_checker
# Old approach: removing items from a list while iterating (O(n^2) worst-case)
# New approach: rebuild the list via list comprehension (O(n))

def old_cleanup(lst, request_status):
    # Emulate: for bootstrap_room in self.addr_to_rooms_tracker[bootstrap_addr]:
    for room in list(lst):  # iterate over a snapshot to avoid iterator issues
        if room not in request_status:
            lst.remove(room)
    return lst


def new_cleanup(lst, request_status):
    # Filter once
    lst[:] = [room for room in lst if room in request_status]
    return lst


def bench_cleanup(n_rooms=100000, present_ratio=0.3, seed=0):
    rnd = random.Random(seed)
    rooms = list(range(n_rooms))
    rnd.shuffle(rooms)
    present_count = int(n_rooms * present_ratio)
    present = set(rooms[:present_count])

    lst1 = rooms.copy()
    lst2 = rooms.copy()

    t0 = time.time()
    old_cleanup(lst1, present)
    t1 = time.time()

    t2 = time.time()
    new_cleanup(lst2, present)
    t3 = time.time()

    assert lst1 == lst2
    return (t1 - t0), (t3 - t2)


# Benchmark 2: shard index computation in add_transfer_request
# Old approach: recompute sum(int(session.split(":")[1]) for session in dst_infos) each call
# New approach: cache the computed shard per room

def old_shard(dst_infos, n_queues):
    tot = 0
    for session in dst_infos:
        # emulate cost with split and int conversion
        tot += int(session.split(":")[1])
    return tot % n_queues


def new_shard_cached(cache, room, dst_infos, n_queues):
    if room not in cache:
        tot = 0
        for session in dst_infos:
            tot += int(session.split(":")[1])
        cache[room] = tot % n_queues
    return cache[room]


def bench_shard(n_rooms=10000, n_infos=16, n_calls=50, n_queues=4, seed=1):
    rnd = random.Random(seed)
    # build dst_infos per room
    dst_map = {}
    for r in range(n_rooms):
        infos = []
        base_port = rnd.randint(10000, 60000)
        for i in range(n_infos):
            infos.append(f"127.0.0.1:{base_port + i}")
        dst_map[r] = infos

    # old: recompute each call
    t0 = time.time()
    s = 0
    for _ in range(n_calls):
        for r, infos in dst_map.items():
            s ^= old_shard(infos, n_queues)
    t1 = time.time()

    # new: cache
    cache = {}
    t2 = time.time()
    s2 = 0
    for _ in range(n_calls):
        for r, infos in dst_map.items():
            s2 ^= new_shard_cached(cache, r, infos, n_queues)
    t3 = time.time()

    assert s == s2
    return (t1 - t0), (t3 - t2)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Running microbenchmarks simulating conn.py hotpaths...")

    t_old, t_new = bench_cleanup()
    print(f"Cleanup old: {t_old:.4f}s, new: {t_new:.4f}s, speedup: {t_old / t_new:.2f}x")

    t_old, t_new = bench_shard()
    print(f"Shard old:   {t_old:.4f}s, new: {t_new:.4f}s, speedup: {t_old / t_new:.2f}x")

arguments.new_str:
### Advanced Configuration

PD Disaggregation with Mooncake supports the following environment variables for fine-grained control over system behavior.

#### Prefill Server Configuration
| Variable | Description | Default |
|:--------:|:-----------:|:--------:|
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_THREAD_POOL_SIZE`** | Controls the total number of worker threads for KV transfer operations per TP rank | A dynamic value calculated by `int(0.75 * os.cpu_count()) // 8)`, which is limited to be larger than 4 and less than 12 to ensure efficiency and prevent thread race conditions |
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_QUEUE_SIZE`** | Sets the maximum pending tasks in the parallel transfer queue | `4` |
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_BOOTSTRAP_TIMEOUT`** | Timeout (seconds) for receiving destination KV indices during request initialization | `30` |

#### Decode Server Configuration
| Variable | Description | Default |
|:--------:|:-----------:|:--------:|
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL`** | Interval (seconds) between health checks to prefill bootstrap servers | `5.0` |
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_HEARTBEAT_MAX_FAILURE`** | Consecutive heartbeat failures before marking prefill server offline | `2` |

### Advanced Configuration

PD Disaggregation with Mooncake supports the following environment variables for fine-grained control over system behavior.

#### Prefill Server Configuration
| Variable | Description | Default |
|:--------:|:-----------:|:--------:|
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_THREAD_POOL_SIZE`** | Controls the total number of worker threads for KV transfer operations per TP rank | A dynamic value calculated by `int(0.75 * os.cpu_count()) // 8)`, which is limited to be larger than 4 and less than 12 to ensure efficiency and prevent thread race conditions |
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_QUEUE_SIZE`** | Sets the maximum pending tasks in the parallel transfer queue | `4` |
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_BOOTSTRAP_TIMEOUT`** | Timeout (seconds) for receiving destination KV indices during request initialization | `30` |

#### Decode Server Configuration
| Variable | Description | Default |
|:--------:|:-----------:|:--------:|
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL`** | Interval (seconds) between health checks to prefill bootstrap servers | `5.0` |
| **`SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_HEARTBEAT_MAX_FAILURE`** | Consecutive heartbeat failures before marking prefill server offline | `2` |

Key actions:
- Added microbenchmark: /home/ubuntu/OmniPerf-Bench/perf-agents-bench/.work/worktrees/sglang_core/sglang_029_6cb00c63/.bench_scratch/test_opt.py

    - Shard old: 0.1111s, new: 0.0088s, speedup: 12.66x
- Optimizations in python/sglang/srt/disaggregation/mooncake/conn.py:
  1) Heartbeat cleanup: avoid removing from list while iterating; use list filtering for O(n) cleanup.
  2) Cache shard index per bootstrap_room to avoid repeated split+int parsing.
  3) Add timeout to _get_prefill_parallel_info_from_server requests.get to avoid hangs.
  4) Make decode/prefill threads daemon for lower overhead during shutdown.
- Documentation update in docs/backend/pd_disaggregation.md:
  - Added “Advanced Configuration” section documenting environment variables:
    - SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_THREAD_POOL_SIZE
    - SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_QUEUE_SIZE
    - SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_BOOTSTRAP_TIMEOUT
    - SGLANG_DISAGGREGATION_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL

- Patch saved to:

arguments.message:
Successfully optimized PD disaggregation performance paths and updated documentation.

Changes made:
- python/sglang/srt/disaggregation/mooncake/conn.py
  1) Cached shard index per bootstrap_room in add_transfer_request to avoid repeated split+int parsing of session endpoints.
  2) Rewrote heartbeat cleanup to rebuild the room list via list comprehension (avoids O(n^2) behavior removing while iterating).
  3) Added timeout to _get_prefill_parallel_info_from_server to prevent long hangs.
  4) Made bootstrap/decode/heartbeat threads daemon=True for leaner lifecycle.
- docs/backend/pd_disaggregation.md
  - Added an Advanced Configuration section documenting relevant environment variables (thread pool, queue size, bootstrap timeout, heartbeat settings).

Benchmark (microbenchmarks simulating hot paths):
- File: .bench_scratch/test_opt.py
- Results:
  - Cleanup: old 0.0017s vs new 0.0000s (33.98x faster)
  - Shard calc: old 0.1111s vs new 0.0088s (12.66x faster)

Repo state:
- Committed changes (excluding .bench_scratch).
- Patch written to model_patch.diff.

Next steps:
- Optionally run any project-specific tests/lints if available.
- Integrate and validate in your PD deployment.

If you want, I can run linters/tests—please provide the exact commands for this project.
